description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: The Donovan Fizzler
description: Before Mr. Donovan resigned last week as Secretary of Labor, supporters in the department had collected a fund for a ''Welcome Home'' party from political appointees in the event that the New York judge dismissed pending larceny and fraud charges against him. But the judge ruled that the case should proceed to trial, and Mr. Donovan then submitted his resignation to President Reagan.

title: MIDDLE-SIZE FARMS ENDANGERED, STUDY SAYS
description: New technology and genetic engineering methods will accelerate the trend toward larger farms in the next 15 years unless the Government provides more help for middle-size farms, a Congressional research service asserted today.

title: ABOUT NEW YORK
description: Welcome to the Alamo,'' said Bill Jensen, an artist, sitting in a colorful cocoon of 150 paintings that is Magoo's Cafe.

title: Prospects Better for Architects
description: YOUNG architects face ''excellent'' employment opportunities for the next five years, according to Randall H. Korman, associate professor of architecture at Syracuse University and head of its graduate program.

title: ALPINE GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $107,000 for the quarter and $307,000 for the 9 months. c-Includes a gain of $1,009,000 from forgiveness of debt and a tax credit of $1,283,000 for the quarter and a gain of $2,258,000 from forgiveness of debt and a tax credit of $1,356,000 for the 9 months.

title: Alonzo Mann, 87, Who Said Lynch Mob Killed Wrong Man
description: Alonzo Mann, who broke a 69- year silence to say the wrong man was convicted of a notorious killing and hanged by a lynch mob that led to a resurgence of the Ku Klux Klan, died Monday from pneumonia at the age of 87.

title: Japan-U.S. Pact on Steel
description: American and Japanese trade officials provided key details today of an agreement reached with Japan to limit that country's shipments of steel to the United States.

title: No-Candy Checkout
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: 2 Bombs in Switzerland Wreck a Factory
description: -VILLE, Switzerland, March 19 (AP) - Two bomb explosions 15 minutes apart tore through a Swiss aluminum factory in this Rhone Valley town early today, causing damage estimated by the owners at $5.4 million.

title: The Order of Things
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: 21.42 RISE PUTS DOW AT 1,271.09
description: Technology and gold issues yesterday joined media stocks in a rally that gave Wall Street its best gain in two months.

title: The Cost of Free Speech
description: At the end of his 1982 New York gubernatorial campaign, Lewis Lehrman stopped snapping his red suspenders on TV and issued a threat. If the voters did not elect him, he would use a secret weapon. He would leave his campaign commercials on for three more years. Lew Lehrman could afford such an expensive exercise in free speech. But what if, instead of promoting himself, he had wanted to spend his money to extol Ronald Reagan? Wouldn't that have violated the Presidential Election Campaign Fund Act, by which Congress tried to impose reasonable financial limits?

title: BELGIAN MISSILE DECISION BACKED
description: The Belgian Government won a confidence vote in Parliament early today on its decision to deploy new cruise missiles in Belgium.

title: Engineer Pleads Guilty In Illegal-Export Case
description: A Maryland engineer pleaded guilty in Federal court today to charges he illegally exported $6.5 million worth of high-technology equipment to an Austrian firm that traded with Soviet bloc countries.

title: 5 IN A JERSEY FAMILY ARE KILLED BY FUMES FROM FAULTY FURNACE
description: Five members of a family were found dead today in their home, apparently killed by carbon monoxide from a faulty furnace after complaining of faintness for several days, investigators said.

title: NEW MERGER ATTRACTION
description: The days when the communications industry was run like an exclusive club, with most of the nation's largest broadcasting and publishing companies as members, may be coming to an end. Although the merger of the American Broadcasting Companies and Capital Cities Communications Inc. is to be a friendly alliance between two of the club members, some analysts say an important element in the transaction was probably fear at ABC of a hostile takeover attempt by a corporate raider or some company outside the communications industry.

title: Sausage Novices
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: Heart Recipient Gaining
description: Murray P. Haydon, an artificial heart patient, was ''breathing much easier'' on a respirator and his puzzling lung complication is expected to clear up in a few days, officials at Human Hospital Audubon here reported today. A spokesman, Robert Irvine, said doctors believed the breathing difficulty was caused by a large number of blood transfusions required by chest bleeding that was stopped by emergency surgery March 2 on the 58-year-old retired automobile worker.

title: THRIFT UNIT REGULATORS OFFER HELP
description: Federal regulators told Gov. Richard F. Celeste of Ohio today that they would expedite the process for bringing closed Ohio savings and loans into the Federal deposit insurance system.

title: Texas Commerce Rating Lowered
description: Texas Commerce Bancshares, whose debt rating was one of the highest assigned to a banking company, was downgraded yesterday by Duff & Phelps, a Chicago rating agency, to D.& P. 3 from D.& P. 2. The only remaining bank holding companies with the D.&P. 2 rating are the P.N.C. Corporation, holding company for Pittsburgh National Bank, J.P. Morgan, and Bancorp Hawaii.

title: JUMPING-JACKS SHOES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
WINANS TELLS OF FINANCIAL PRESSURES
description: The life styles of a rich stockbroker and a financially hard-pressed journalist were seen in sharp contrast yesterday as a former Wall Street Journal reporter, R. Foster Winans, testified in his court trial that he participated in a stock trading scheme ''to get out from under some bills that had piled up.''

title: MAX & ERMA'S RESTAURANTS reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 17
description: b-Net loss

title: TELCO SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-Includes an extraordinary credit of $121,000, or 2 cents a share.

title: WD-40 CO reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
Chevron Planning
description: The recent approval of the Chevron Corporation's 1984 acquisition of the Gulf Oil Corporation has ended a ''frustrating'' period of waiting and will allow the two companies to begin ''very active planning'' for merging the two staffs, George M. Keller, Chevron's chairman, said yesterday. Mr. Keller said that it was not clear how many of their combined 60,000 employees would be retained. Chevron has offered early retirement to about 10,000 employees, and about 2,000 have accepted it.

title: DAYS OF MULES AND ICE CREAM
description: If a group of enthusiastic Tennesseans has its way, Oct. 26 will become Mule Appreciation Day, approved by Congress and proclaimed by the President. The ice cream industry hopes July will be declared Ice Cream Month, as it was last year, and the week of April 21 could do multiple duty as Jewish Heritage Week, National Organ Donation Awareness Week, National DES Awareness Week and National Drug Abuse Education and Prevention Week.

title: MARKET GROWS FOR IMPORTED FRESH FOOD
description: EUGENE FRACCIA, owner of Pesca, a seafood restaurant on East 22d Street, estimates that during the restaurant's 10-week shrimp festival that will end the first week in April, approximately 1,400 pounds of fresh shrimp from Italy, France, Belgium, Hawaii and Louisiana will have been served.

title: HUMANA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CARTER HAWLEY HALE STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 2
description: b-Includes nonoperating income of $10,090,000 and a gain of $9,703,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter and nonoperating income of $10,800,000 and a gain of $12,100,000 from dicontinued operations for the year. c-Includes a nonoperating loss of $1,100,000 and a gain of $62,540,000 from discontinued operations.

title: PEPITONE ARRESTED ON DRUG CHARGES
description: Joe Pepitone, the former New York Yankee player, was arrested in Brooklyn late Monday night after plainclothes police officers found drugs, drug paraphernalia and a loaded handgun in a car in which he was riding, the police said.

title: OXFORD FIRST CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $249,000 for the quarter and $405,000 for the year. c-After a loss from discontinued operations of $48,000. d-After a gain from discontinued operations of $102,000.

title: TWO FILMS ENTER THE DEBATE ON ABORTION ISSUE IN ALBANY
description: Abortion - an issue that divides the Legislature on emotional rather than political lines - has become the subject of an unusual debate here.

title: BOLIVIAN WORKERS, REJECTTING PACT, VOW TO 'RADICALIZE' THEIR STRIKE
description: Efforts by the Government to negotiate an end to a 12-day general strike here collapsed Monday night, and today thousands of workers marched through the streets of this Andean capital, some calling for a popular workers state.

title: CLAMPDOWN ON STUDENTS REFLECTS KENYAN UNEASE
description: Recent unrest among university students here has illuminated the uneasiness that the Government of this East African nation still feels nearly three years after an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow President Daniel arap Moi.

title: Mengele Can Be Seized, Justice Dept. Says
description: If the United States can track down Dr. Josef Mengele in a foreign country, it can probably detain him and turn him over to one of the nations that wants to try him for Nazi war crimes, the Justice Department told Congress today.

title: MATH BOX INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
;   Nuclear-Waste Disposal Reaches Critical Stage
description: To the Editor:

title: KOCH AND WAGNER DISCUSS THEIR ERAS
description: The question posed to the current and former Mayors last night, about halfway through a university-sponsored symposium, was about crime - why it was so pervasive and what could be done to restore civility.

title: DRAB CRUISE-LINE PIER TRANSFORMED INTO A DAZZLING GARDEN
description: A flower show has returned to the city. It is more than welcome on this first day of spring. After a 15-year hiatus, the big event opened yesterday at a new home, the Hudson River Exhibition Pier, at 50th Street. Visitors will be pleased. Hundreds of pink tulips, purple hyacinths, yellow daffodils, orchids in many colors, primroses, anemones and bright red azaleas have turned the tunnel- like pier into a beautiful spring garden. Golden honey locusts, bamboo and crab apples, forced into leaf and flower, form a canopy for the enchantment.

title: DANCE: CHARLES MOULTON COMPANY
description: LIKE many dance experimentalists today, Charles Moulton is seeking to marry a new form of theatricality to the formalist concerns that first brought him to public attention as a choreographer.

title: MACGREGOR SPORTING GOODS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After tax credits of $629,200, or 13 cents a a share, for the quarter and $910,000, or 19 cents a share, for the 6 months. c-After tax credits of $274,300, or 7 cents a share, for the quarter and $436,100, or 11 cents a share, for the 6 months.

title: HOUSING STARTS ARE DOWN 11%
description: Housing construction fell a steep 11 percent in February, the biggest decline in almost a year, the Commerce Department said today.

title: FLOWER SHOW IS BACK WITH A PAMPERED FLOURISH OF SPRING
description: A truck full of lemon trees was unloaded on Friday. The conifers were positioned on Sunday. Forty thousand tulips arrived Monday. But the 10-foot-high bamboo plants, which were to be in by Friday, were stuck over the weekend at a truck depot in Queens, only complicating an already arduous task: putting on the New York Flower Show.

title: Cornell Balloting On Cyanide Pills
description: Cornell University students are voting today and Wednesday on whether cyanide pills should be kept in the campus health center to provide ''a swift, painless end'' in the event of nuclear war.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE ;   Seattle Steel's Head Is New to Business
description: The mighty have fallen in the steel industry, but that does not stop new people from coming in to try their hand. One is Carl E. Meitzen, whose background is insurance. He is the new president of the newly named Seattle Steel Corporation.

title: PERSONAL HEALTH
description: THOUGH people have known probably since they evolved that it takes two - a man and a woman - to produce a baby, until the 1960's little if any attention was paid to the man when a couple failed to conceive. A combination of ignorance and male conceit led most to think of infertility as a woman's problem. Faced with the ego-threatening possibility that they might be unable to father children, many men even refused to submit to examinations.

title: Control the Leverage Gamblers
description: Most people, including many investment professionals, don't know the difference between a leveraged commodity contract and a plate of veal parmesan. That suits the handful of dealers the law permits to sell leveraged contracts. The less the public understands about these variations on commodities futures, the better chance the dealers have to escape effective regulation. Committee hearings in the House this week can produce a remedy for the oversight.

title: RESTAURANT MANAGEMENT SERVICES reports earnings for 16wks to Feb 17
INSTALLMENT DEBT CLIMBS
description: Americans took on $7.22 billion more in installment debt than they paid off in January, the Government reported today.

title: TELEPHONE & DATA SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,043,000 for the quarter and $1,824,000 for the year. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $329,000 for the quarter and $483,000 for the year.

title: An Agency For Health Care Ads
description: THERE are, according to Patricia Martin, a former Warner-

title: HOUSTON AIDE ACCUSED OF ILL-TREATING VIETNAMESE
description: The head of a public housing tenants' organization testified today that the executive director of the Houston Housing Authority had displayed a pattern of treating Vietnamese tenants with contempt and using a racial epithet in referring to them.

title: STOCKER & YALE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said that net income in the latest periods includes $230,000 from benefit for deferred taxes related to DISC.

title: DEPLETED NETS ARE TROUNCED BY BUCKS
description: Early in the fourth period tonight, Stan Albeck looked at the end of his bench and saw George Johnson and Wayne Sappleton - and no one else.

title: WISCONSIN BOARD REVOKES LICENSE OF NURSE IN MERCY KILLING OF MAN
description: The State Board of Nursing today revoked the license of a registered nurse who disconnected the life-support equipment of an elderly stroke victim in an act of mercy.

title: 15-Year Prison Term Is Given in Wildlife Case
description: A man convicted of violating Federal laws by killing and selling protected wildlife species was sentenced today to 15 years in prison.

title: ALLIED PRODUCTS CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a loss of $5,127,000 from discontinued operations, a gain of $793,000 from termination of a pension plan, and a tax credit of $6,397,000. c-Net loss after loss of $3,470,000 from discontinued operations.

title: METS BELT WHITSON AND YANKS
description: It was only a spring-training game, so nothing counted. But, as the Mets pointed out, it all happened: They raked Ed Whitson with 10 hits and 6 runs in two early innings, Gary Carter and Darryl Strawberry hit successive home runs and the Mets rolled over the Yankees, 8-2, to win the first round of the 1985 rivalry to see who owns New York.

title:
SPORTS OF THE TIMES;

'FORMERLY OF THE YANKEES'
description: ''Show 'em the scar, Joe.'' Joe Pepitone never needed much prodding from his older teammates. He would take off his T-shirt in the clubhouse and show the red marks on his chest and back, where the bullet had entered and where it had departed.

title: ANOTHER OPINION OFFERED
description: New York State boxing officials, in response to the American Medical Association's proposal that the sport be banned, produced a second opinion yesterday from its own medical staff.

title: Griffin Retires
description: Archie Griffin, the only player to win the Heisman Trophy two times, announced his retirement from football yesterday. The 30-year-old running back had started four games this season for the Jacksonville Bulls of United States Football League.

title: PICO PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income

title: Muller Jordan Weiss Gets Aamco Business
description: Muller Jordan Weiss has been selected by the Greater New York Aamco Dealers Association to buy its broadcast advertising, which comes to about $2 million. It also may create some advertising, but most advertising will be sent down from Cunningham & Walsh, recently appointed creative agency for Aamco Transmission's national account.

title: BALLET: CASTING CHANGES AT THE JOFFREY
description: THE Joffrey Ballet was a mad whirl of new casting in two performances on Sunday at the New York State Theater. One of the notable changes was the placing of Leslie Carothers that afternoon in the ballerina role in Philip Jerry's intriguing new ''Hexameron.'' Miss Carothers has a clear, unaffected classical style that makes her a consistent pleasure to watch, and her clean legwork and proud carriage were a perfect medium for Mr. Jerry's literate but juicy exploration of classical ballet conventions.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES;
description: MEN AND ANGELS. By Mary Gordon.

title: NATIONAL DATA COMMUNICAIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
STATE TAX DEPT. DENIES IT IS LAX IN ENFORCEMENT
description: The State Taxation and Finance Department today vigorously disputed charges that it has not been enforcing tax laws.

title: CARTIER AND 2 MANAGERS INDICTED ON SALES TAX
description: Cartier Inc. and two executives of its Fifth Avenue jewelry store have been indicted and charged with a scheme to let their customers avoid sales taxes, city and state officials announced yesterday.

title: Whose Move?
description: Hail Flutie, Chapter 2:

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 20, 1985 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Article 106186 -- No Title
description: Two men representing a syndicate of investors say a last-minute decision helped them win a $764,283 jackpot at Sportsman's Park in suburban Cicero, the largest payoff in North American thoroughbred racing history.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I am pleased that the Senate today voted to support the MX Peacekeeper missile and to send a message of American resolve to the world.'' - President Reagan. (A1:6.)

title: National Rhythm
description: Shortly after 1 o'clock this afternoon, Maj. James M. Bankhead

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES ;   New Company Offers Municipal Insurance
description: Rapid growth of the municipal bond insurance business - where loss experience is low to nonexistent and annual premiums were well in excess of $200 million last year - continues to attract new companies. Last year, about 21 percent of all new tax-exempt bonds were insured, and analysts expect that percentage may rise to 25 percent this year.

title: Ally & Gargano Joins Six-Agency Venture
description: Ally & Gargano is the United States member of a new six-agency joint venture network that will be coordinated from London.

title: SENATE SUPPORTS MX FUND TO MAKE 21 MORE MISSILES
description: The Reagan Administration scored an important victory today as the Senate voted decisively in favor of releasing $1.5 billion for the construction of 21 additional MX missiles.

title: Q&A
description: Q.

title: People
description: Walter K. Flynn promoted to vice president and general manager, sales and marketing, at ABC Owned Television Stations.

title: WELDOTRON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
New Chinese Envoy to U.S.
description: A Chinese Deputy Foreign Minister, Han Xu, has been designated the next Ambassador to the United States and is likely to assume the post in May, American officials said here today.

title: CHRISTIAN-MOSLEM FIGHTING PARALYZES LEBANESE PORT
description: Christian and Moslem militiamen clashed in southern Lebanon today, forcing Moslem families to flee Christian-controlled areas and paralyzing activity in the Mediterranean port of Sidon.

title: Odd Man In
description: With the national collegiate basketball tournament now well under way, there have been any number of opportunities to witness the sublime. Now, for those who may have missed the ridiculous:

title: PARENTS WARNED ON ANIMAL EASTER GIFTS
description: Candy bunnies and chicks for Easter are already being featured in markets, and soon their live counterparts will also appear. But the Humane Society of the United States is urging parents not to give children pets as Easter gifts.

title: POWER-PLAY GOALS BEAT DEVILS
description: The Devils continued to play listless hockey at the critical point of the season and tonight suffered their fifth consecutive defeat, losing by 4-1 to the Washington Capitals.

title: GENERAL HOST CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 27
description: b-Includes a loss of $181,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter and income from discontinued operations of $39,675,000 for the year. c-Includes income from discontinued operations of $3,700,000 for the quarter and $5,480,000 for the year. The year-ago fourth quarter results have been restated due to a change in the company's fiscal year. The results for the latest year include the results of Flower Time Inc., from the March 2, 1984, acquistion date. The results of Frank's Nursery & Crafts Inc. are included from the March 7, 1983, acquisition date. All share earnings restated to reflect a 3-for-2 stock split distributed on March 4, 1985.

title: REBEL CHIEF WARNS SANDINISTAS
description: The leader of the largest Nicaraguan rebel group urged the Managua Government today to accept a peace initiative proposed by a group of Nicaraguan opposition leaders this month.

title: 10 3/4% Illinois Power Bond A $150 million, 30-year, tax-
description: exempt bond financing by the

title: SENATE ROLL-CALL ON MX MISSILES
description: Following is the roll-call vote by which the Senate today approved spending $1.5 billion for 21 more MX missiles.

title: Low Inflation's Beneficiaries
description: MANY analysts believe the currently benign inflation rate - slightly under 4 percent versus nearly 12 percent a few years ago - will continue for some time. This, they say, should provide investment opportunities in disinflationary industries such as chemicals, basic metals, consumer durable goods and pharmaceuticals.

title: O'CONNOR'S REMARKS ON IRELAND START FUROR IN BRITAIN
description: Remarks by Archbishop John J. O'Connor during his St. Patrick's Day mass on Saturday have generated a storm of criticism from British officials and newspapers who construed them as encouraging violence in Northern Ireland.

title: MOTT'S SUPER MARKETS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
EXECUTIVE CHANGES
FOODARAMA SUPERMARKETS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 2
description: b-Net loss. c-Includes a gain of 32 cents a share on the sale of a store.

title: South St. Pavilion Is Renting
description: WITH the Pier 17 Pavilion, the largest commercial component of the South Street Seaport, scheduled to open this summer, developers of the building have agreements for renting 60 percent of its space and are optimistic that the balance will be taken well before the doors open.

title: WASHINGTON TIMES APPOINTS AN AUTHOR AS ITS EDITOR IN CHIEF
description: Arnaud de Borchgrave, a novelist and former senior editor and chief foreign correspondent for the magazine Newsweek, will succeed Smith Hempstone as editor in chief of The Washington Times, the newspaper announced today.

title: India Orders Troops To City to Quell Fighting
description: Indian troops were ordered into the western city of Ahmadabad today to quell violence that has killed at least a dozen people in the last three weeks.

title: IN ETHIOPIA, A LITTLE RAIN BRINGS A LITTLE HOPE
description: -It rained here today. Not much, in terms of what is needed, but enough to raise hopes in this drought-tortured African country that the seasonal ''short rains'' - which failed completely last year - might actually have arrived.

title: KENTUCKY UTILITIES CO reports earnings for Year to Feb 28
Challenge to Rorer
description: Cooper Laboratories said it was soliciting proxies for Rorer Group Inc.'s annual meeting to try to defeat an anti-takeover measure that Rorer's board adopted last month. In a letter to Rorer shareholders, Cooper Labs, which holds slightly more than one million shares, or nearly 5 percent of the company's stock, called the measure a ''poison pill'' intended to make Rorer unattractive to potential buyers.

title: Dissatisfied Royal
description: Frank White, Kansas City's star second baseman, has been offered one of those Royals-forever contracts, but not one to his liking. Unlike the multiyear guaranteed contracts, plus options, that the team's co- owner,

title: Ex-Lottery Chief Pleads Guilty
description: The former chairman of the State Lottery Commission admitted today that he had given false documents to an ethics panel investigating ties to companies doing business with the lottery.

title: LLOYD IS UPSET IN OPENING ROUND
description: Sometimes it is the prospect of beating Chris Evert Lloyd that makes some players' knees buckle and their backhands sink harmlessly into the net. It is when an opponent is on the threshold of victory that Mrs. Lloyd often takes command, relying much on her reputation as the cool baseliner who rarely makes the crucial mistake.

title: BUFFETT'S LOW-KEY ROLE IN HIGH-STAKES DEAL
description: On Wall Street, Warren E. Buffett is known as the investor with the Midas touch. For years the man whom Fortune magazine once called ''the wizard of Omaha'' has focused on publishing companies, especially newspapers, but now he is turning his attention to the airwaves.

title: SOVERN FEARS COLLEGES' DECLINE
description: The quality of the nation's colleges and universities could seriously deteriorate over the next decade because the graduate programs that lead to teaching careers are not attracting enough of the best students, the president of Columbia University warned yesterday.

title: Leaks Found in Propane Line To Damaged Utah Ski Lodge
description: Two leaks were found in the line that carried propane to a ski lodge damaged in an explosion last week, officials say.

title: Pentagon Gives Faulty Copy Of Disputed Weinberger Talk
description: The Pentagon today accused the press of misinterpreting remarks made by Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger in Canada and then issued a transcript of his remarks that omitted a relevant passage.

title: World Markets React to Bank Ills
description: Ohio's banking crisis spread to the international financial markets today and was blamed for a rise of about $36 an ounce in the price of gold and a sharp decline for the dollar.

title: WEDNESDAY SPORTS Basketball
description: Nets vs. Cleveland Cavaliers , at Richfield, Ohio, 7:30 P.M. The Cavaliers are fighting for their first playoff spot since 1978.

title: MUSIC: PARIS ORCHESTRA AND BRUCKNER'S EIGHTH
description: DANIEL BARENBOIM came to town on a promise that his French band would deliver idiomatic Bruckner, and he made it good Monday night at Carnegie Hall. The Orchestre de Paris devoted the first of four programs it will give this week entirely to the massive Eighth Symphony, and if the rest are as handsomely played as this it will be a memorable visit.

title: ELSINORE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $7,456,000 on the early extinguishment of debt. The year-earlier quarter was only two months long because of a change from a fiscal year ending Jan. 31 to a calendar year. Year-ago figures are for 11 months because of a change in the ending date of the fiscal year.

title: Canon Will Build 2 Kodak Copiers
description: The Eastman Kodak Company introduced two new copying machines that will be made by Canon Inc. of Japan but sold exclusively by Kodak.

title: Whither Funderburk?
description: The Foreign Service experts at

title: Iran Repeats Gas Charge
description: Iran's Deputy Foreign Minister, Hussein Kazempour-Ardebili, said today that about 20 Iranian soldiers who he said were injured by chemical weapons in recent combat with Iraq would be sent to Vienna, Bonn, Munich and London ''in the next day or two'' as evidence that Iraq was using chemical weapons.

title: REAGAN'S MX VICTORY: EYE ON AUDIENCE OVERSEAS
description: The latest round of the seemingly endless political confrontations over the MX missile kindled little public controversy in this country, but it provided a victory that the Reagan Administration badly wanted to impress a wider audience in the Soviet Union and Western Europe. Indeed, today's solid 55- to-45 vote in favor of the intercontinental missile probably has more significance for the public diplomacy surrounding the arms talks in Geneva than as a demonstration of President Reagan's legislative influence on other issues or of Senate confidence in the missile itself.

title: Accounts
description: Pasta & Cheese to Levy, Flaxman & Associates, for its retail stores and product advertising.

title: Debt Issues
description: Citicorp sold $100 million of 91-day commercial paper at an average rate of 9.055 percent, up from 8.931 percent last week, and $50 million of 182-day paper at an average of 9.445 percent, up from 9.305 percent.

title: WINE TALK
description: PARIS FRENCH intellectuals are ever convinced that, unlike their wine, their language is in a state of decline. They blame this on the insidious influence of American culture - to which, of course, they are hopelessly addicted. Enraged by this paradox they revile us and brand our culture banal. They mount campaigns against words such as ''ferryboat'' and ''weekend'' and indignantly call on the authorities to uproot signs at busy intersections that say ''stop.''

title: DISCOVERIES
description: 1.*Double-Duty Puzzle ederic Auguste Bartholdi is 100 years old, and in celebration, anyone who buys Build Your Own Statue of Liberty ($7.95, Doubleday) at a Fifth Avenue Card Shop not only can make a 27-inch-high paper statue but is also contributing 25 cents to the statue's rebuilding fund.

title: No Headline
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 20, 1985 International

title: Ortega Assails Bush
description: President Daniel Ortega Saavedra of Nicaragua said today that Vice President Bush ''has neither the willingness, maturity nor seriousness'' required to negotiate an end to the conflict in Nicaragua.

title: WAUSAU PAPER MILLS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
U.S. GROUP IN SOUTH AFRICA URGES CHANGES
description: The American Chamber of Commerce in South Africa urged the white authorities today for the first time to make radical changes in their policy of racial separation and to pardon militant political foes.

title: Control Of Storer Is Sought
description: A group of investors said yesterday that it wants to gain control of the Storer Communications Corporation and then liquidate the Miami-based broadcasting and cable television concern.

title: MASS-TRANSIT SYSTEM EXPERT
description: Walter S. Douglas, an authority on planning and design of urban and regional mass transportation systems, died Friday at his home in Jamestown, R.I., after a long illness. The 73-year- old engineer moved to Jamestown from Plainfield, N.J., in 1977.

title: Blame the Hospital
description: To the Editor:

title: 'BUDGET PROCESS' IS AN OXYMORON
description: In the course of Budget Committee deliberations, a Republican Senator referred to some proposition or other as an ''oxymoron.'' This raised eyebrows, and after the Senator volunteered ''Postal Service'' - a built-in contradiction in terms - as an example, the media folk got a contest going.

title: FOOD FOLLIES OF THOSE WHO SHOULD KNOW BETTER
description: NO one has put it better than M. F. K. Fisher, who once wrote that ''almost every person has something secret he likes to eat.'' I am particularly amused by the ''secret'' foods that appeal to food professionals. I know one who is obsessive about the cherry in his Manhattan and another who was caught enjoying a hamburger at a fast-food counter.

title: SmithKline Contracts
description: The SmithKline Beckman Corporation could lose some of its Pentagon contracts because of its guilty pleas last year to Federal misdemeanors, a Defense Department spokesman said today.

title: Pitt Player Suspended
description: Tony Williams, a freshman wide receiver, has been suspended from the Pitt football team by Coach

title: SUPERMARKETS GENERAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 2
description: Supermarkets General acquired all of the outstanding stock of Purity Supreme Inc. on Aug. 8, 1984, for a cash payment of $79,250,000. Purity's results of operations are included in the company's statement of earnings subsequent to the date of acquisition. The latest periods comprised of 14 weeks for the quarter and 53 weeks for the year, compared with 13 weeks and 52 weeks for the year-ago quarter and year, respectively.

title: Vote for Espo ;   The wishful-thinking award of the week:
description: To the forlorn soul high in the blue seats who, before Sunday night's game at the Garden between the Rangers and the Devils, hoisted a banner that said, ''Espo G-M and Coach Now.''

title: REAGAN WELCOMES ARGENTINE LEADER
description: President Reagan welcomed the President of Argentina to the White House today, an occasion that Mr. Reagan used to renew his denunciations of the Government of Nicaragua.

title: TEXAS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-Includes losses relating to discontinued operations of $27,000 for the quarter and $1,055,000 for the 9 months.

title: LEVI STRAUSS & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 24
description: b-Includes an after-tax charge of about $5,000,000 for the consolidation of the company's European business.

title: Memorial for a Hero
description: His stunning conquests of Sicily and Naples led to the creation of a united Italy. Throughout Italy his name endures. And it adorns a used- car lot in Brooklyn.

title: On the Remoteness
description: Of 1960's Paraguay

title: PROSECUTION OVER RESISTANCE WAS PRESSED AGAINST 18 MEN
description: Today's Supreme Court decision on policy toward draft resisters cleared the way for Federal prosecution of David Alan Wayte, who wrote the White House and the Selective Service system promising never to register. It affects only 17 other young men.

title: 'SOFT LANDING' NEEDED FOR U.S.
description: WORRIES about the American economy, stemming from the banking crisis in Ohio, have sent the dollar falling, the price of gold climbing, ruined the appetite of foreign investors for United States Government securities and corporate bonds, and pushed up interest rates.

title: FOOD NOTES
description: Authentically French

title: NEW PLAN REALTY TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
BRENT SUTTER IS OUT FOR 3 TO 4 WEEKS
description: The Islanders' chances of regaining the Stanley Cup suffered a major blow when the club learned tonight that Brent Sutter would be lost for the rest of the regular season and probably through the first round of the playoffs.

title: WALL STREET HAILS TV MERGER
description: The stock market gave a ringing endorsement yesterday to the $3.5 billion purchase of the American Broadcasting Companies by Capital Cities Communications Inc. as the two corporations began the process of melding their operations.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day on Monday about waste conversion misidentified the company that built an unsuccessful garbage-to-energy plant in Bridgeport, Conn. It was Combustion Equipment Associates.

title: Jackson Has Learned to Play His Role
description: Role playing may be great for actors and actresses, but it's often tough on athletes, especially those who have started for all of their career, and now find themselves performing spot duty. But for Mark Jackson, St. John's 6-foot-3-inch sophomore point guard, reserve duty has in many ways helped him perform more effectively.

title: LIQUOR STORE CONTROL DEBATED
description: Ever since Prohibition ended in 1933, state-run liquor stores have been as much a part of Pennsylvania's landscape as the steel mills along the Monongahela River or the anthracite mines of the state's coal- laden mountain ridges.

title: When Cops Go Berserk
description: ''Incomprehensible.'' That was the right word from New York's Police Commissioner, Benjamin Ward, when he learned that one of his sergeants was charged with running down and killing a pedestrian, injuring another, then fleeing the scene.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE;
description: SHORTS ONSTAGE

title: Listen and Learn
description: Thomas Hearns, in an interview in the May issue of Playboy magazine, recalls the wallop of his life: ''The hardest I've ever been hit was by my father, when I was 13, and it made me cry. I was up to some boyish mischief, and my father really slammed me. My father has always been like E. F. Hutton: When he says something, I listen.''

title: REAGAN-MULRONEY PARLEY IS DEBATED
description: Prime Minister Brian Mulroney today defended his meeting with President Reagan against accusations in Parliament that he had shown himself too willing to placate the United States.

title: CREDIT MARKETS ;   Interest Rates Fall Modestly
description: Interest rates declined modestly yesterday, with most of the fall coming late in the day, after the Treasury announced plans to sell $16.25 billion of new notes and bonds next week.

title: AN EMPIRE BUILDER WITHOUT USUAL EGO: THOMAS SAWYER MURPHY
description: Thomas Sawyer Murphy, the 59- year-old chairman of Capital Cities Communications and the next head of ABC, has built an extensive communications empire that includes dozens of publishing and broadcast companies. But in so doing, he has remained a private man, who generally wins plaudits from people whose companies he has acquired.

title: STAGE: 'CONDUCT OF LIFE'
description: ALTHOUGH the harrowing central characters in ''The Conduct of Life'' seem to speak their lines in heavy capital letters, it would be hard to fault any of the sentiments behind the portentous one-act drama that Maria Irene Fornes has written and directed at the Theater for the New City.

title: A Presidential Triumph Over Credibility
description: To the Editor:

title: Jury Questions Raines
description: Tim Raines, the Montreal Expo outfielder, joined the parade of major league players questioned by a Federal grand jury in Pittsburgh investigating drug trafficking. Raines, who was treated for cocaine abuse three years ago, skipped an exhibition game to keep his date with the jury on Monday, and refused to comment afterward.

title: DANCERS GET 'HEALTHY NOISE' FROM PUPILS
description: JAMILLAH GOULD balanced on the edge of the seat, her feet barely touching the floor. She swayed with the music as four dancers leaped and bowed, tumbled and swirled across the stage. ''I love it because they look like plastic,'' said Jamillah, a first grader at Public School 28 in Manhattan. ''I like the way they make people laugh.''

title: CONCERT: YALE ENSEMBLE
description: THE Yale Contemporary Ensemble, in residence at the Yale School of Music in New Haven, began its Saturday evening program at Merkin Concert Hall with a delightful and unusual Divertimento by Boris Blacher. This sequence of fanfares and serenades, scored for trumpet, trombone and piano, combines contrapuntal density with an easy accessibility, and deserves a wider audience.

title: MICHIGAN U. DAILY, MUCKRAKER OF 1960'S, STRIVES FOR RELEVANCE
description: Twenty years ago, when talk of racism, war and politics dominated college campuses, some students at the University of Michigan praised The Michigan Daily and others picketed it. But six mornings a week throughout the school year nearly everyone read it.

title: FINANCIAL CORP. OUTFLOW $98 MILLION IN ONE DAY
description: The Financial Corporation of America said today that its net deposit outflow on Monday was $98 million. It was the highest daily amount since the heavy outflow began March 11, the first business day after the company announced a projected loss of between $500 million and $700 million for 1984.

title: Nutrition Advice
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: CENTRAL SOYA CO reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $2,200,000 in the quarter and $3,100,000 in the six months.

title: SYSTEMATICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
DRAFT RESISTERS' PROSECUTIONS UPHELD
description: The Supreme Court ruled today that the Federal Government did not violate the Constitution when it enforced the draft registration law by selecting only avowed resisters for prosecution.

title: New Futures Contract
description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission unanimously approved the Chicago Mercantile Exchange's application to trade options on three-month Eurodollar futures contracts. The contract, the first futures option on short-term interest rates, would give the holder the right to buy or sell a million-dollar futures contract at a set price at a later time.

title: Espionage Trial Begins For Emigre Couple
description: Two emigres from the Soviet Union went on trial on espionage charges today as a judge began the search for jurors for the case, which involves a former agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: EGYPT USED SCUD IN '73 WAR
description: Scud is the NATO code name for a family of Soviet short-range artillery rockets first developed in the 1950's.

title: 2 Die in Brighton Beach Fire That Officials Call Suspicious
description: Two men were killed and a firefighter was injured last night in a blaze that fire officials described as suspicious at a factory and residential building in the Brighton Beach section of Brooklyn, authorities said.

title: Cooling-System Tests at Seabrook
description: The New Hampshire Yankee division of the Public Service Company of New Hampshire said that construction of the Seabrook nuclear power project's major components was complete and first tests of the plant's cooling system had been made. It said the project as a whole was 85 percent complete.

title: ROSE'S STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 30
U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: Folk Festival on L.I. At Community College
description: The 14th annual Nassau Community College Folk Festival will begin March 26, with Oscar Brand as host and the performers Mike Cross, Heather Forest, Robert Mandel, Battlefield Band and Taj Mahal. A workshop, ''The Blues,'' will be given by Taj Mahal, Harlem Blues and Jazz Band and George Gritzbach at 11:30 A.M.

title: C.I.A. DRAFTS A BILL TO GUARD SECRETS
description: The Central Intelligence Agency has sent the White House a proposal to make it a crime for Government employees to disclose national security secrets without authorization, Administration officials said today.

title: WILLIAMS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Wang Labs' Soft Earnings BOSTON, March 19 (Reuters) - John Cunningham,
description: president of Wang Laboratories Inc., said the company's

title: A NEW LIFE FOR THE SHORT STORY
description: The conventional wisdom about the fate of short-story collections is that they do not sell - except now and then. But judged by the new book- publishing lists - and the growing number of literary magazines that offer outlets for big names as well as unknowns - the conventional wisdom may no longer hold up.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Weekend on March 8 about museums in New York mansions incorrectly described the site of the Morris-Jumel mansion. It is not the highest point in Manhattan; that is in Bennett Park between West 183d Street and West 185th Streets.

title: FILM: 'MISSISSIPPI BLUES'
description: ONE of the last, lingering images in ''Mississippi Blues,'' which opens today at the Film Forum, is that of an elderly black man playing a homemade flute while sitting on a weatherbeaten, horse-drawn wagon. The man is surrounded by a French documentary crew, also seen on camera, which records his every move as though no horse, wagon or blues musician had ever before been captured on the screen.

title: WASH A DISH? FIX A TANK? THE ISRAELIS WANT YOU
description: If the Volunteers for Israel program had travel brochures, they might read, ''Come to Israel, meet the people, see the land and learn how to repair the engine of a Patton tank or wash dishes for 1,000 soldiers.''

title: I.B.M. DROPS PCJR PRODUCTION
description: The International Business Machines Corporation said yesterday that it will cease production next month of its PCjr home computer, a machine that never quite caught on in the marketplace.

title: MANSFIELD REASSURES JAPAN ON U.S. POLICY IN PARLEYS ON ARMS
description: The United States Ambassador to Japan, Mike Mansfield, last night offered assurances that the United States would not sign an arms accord with the Soviet Union that ignored the security concerns of Japan and America's other Asian allies.

title: NAVY ASKS REFUND ON MILLIONS IN FEES
description: John F. Lehman, the Navy Secretary, has ordered legal moves against a contractor that has tried to collect from the Government almost $25 million in expenses incurred in a lawsuit with a rival, Pentagon officials disclosed this evening.

title: Katy Sale Talks
description: Katy Industries confirmed in a statement that discussions were continuing on a possible sale or merger of its 98 percent owned Missouri-Kansas- Texas Railroad Company. Katy said that it could not predict when a definitive agreement would be reached or if the Interstate Commerce Commission would grant approval. The company also said that its 1984 results, to be reported this month, would reflect greater loss reserves for its Midland Insurance Company subsidiary than previously reported.

title: JEWISH MAGAZINE AWARDS
description: The author of a book documenting American failures to rescue European Jews from Nazi extermination said yesterday that full disclosure of the ''terrible mistakes'' made by all sides, including the American Jewish leadership, was needed to help avert another Holocaust.

title: PRIME-TIME CARTOONS
description: CARTOONS, or animated features, are a constant on television, although usually not in prime time. That's unfortunate because cartoons can have charm. ''Snoopy's Getting Married, Charlie Brown'' is rich in charm, and it's pleasant to see it at 8 tonight on CBS. It celebrates, as ''Peanuts'' cartoons always do, gentle virtues.

title: Hess Captures Slalom Race
description: Erika Hess of Switzerland won a World Cup slalom ski race today, her first victory of the year, and moved into first place in the season slalom standing.

title: A GLASS DOUBLE BOILER
description: MOST home cooks know what to expect from double boilers, in terms of looks and abilities. Double boilers, with their pot-within-pot arrangement, are essential for making anything that requires constant gentle heat - custards, egg-based sauces of all kinds, chocolate and more. Now, the Corning Glass Works has created a new line of pots, called Visions Cookware, that includes a double boiler with a contemporary look and surprising versatility.

title: METROPOLITAN DIARY
description: FOR almost 200 years, ''The Old Farmer's Almanac'' has been compiling observations on subjects such as the weather, the solar system, the habits of animals and other natural phenomena that, it is said, enable country dwellers to forecast events of the future. Why then, wonders Hugh B. Jordan, a resident of Murray Hill, N.J., has no one accumulated lore that would present city folks with similar sagacity? Thus it is that Mr. Jordan has commenced collecting for an ''Old New Yorker's Almanac,'' with the following contributions:

title: GOLD SOARS ON WORRIES ABOUT OHIO
description: Gold prices soared about $36 an ounce yesterday, in one of the largest one-day jumps since gold trading was legalized in the United States 10 years ago.

title: 60-MINUTE GOURMET
description: LUTHER BURBANK, the renowned horticulturist, is supposed to have described the macadamia as ''the perfect nut.'' That seems to me a fitting description. Macadamias are one of the richest of all fruits shaken from a tree and, although they are most often eaten out of hand, they can be put to excellent uses in the kitchen, especially in making desserts. Macadamias do marvelous things to pies, nut bars and ice cream, for instance. They are also excellent when used as a breading for fish, making crisp and tasty coating for pieces of flounder, striped bass and so on.

title: COMPUTER STORE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income

title: Bridge:Linz Team Holds On to Win In Women's Knockout Play
description: Five days of fierce competition in women's knockout team play ended at 1 o'clock this morning in a victory for a sextet headed by Rama Linz of Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: INDIANA TOPS RICHMOND, 75-53
description: Uwe Blab, Indiana's 7-foot- 2-inch center, scored 17 points tonight as the Hoosiers rolled to a 75-53 victory over Richmond in the second round of the National Invitation Tournament.

title: West German Prices
description: Producer prices in West Germany rose three-tenths of 1 percent in February from a month earlier and 3.1 percent from February 1984, the Government said today.

title: Vietnam Is Said to Seek Better Ties With U.S.
description: Vietnam is proposing to normalize relations with the United States as a way of eventually settling the Cambodia conflict, Indonesia's Foreign Minister, Mochtar Kusumaatmadja, said today.

title: Rocket Launching Canceled
description: The launching of an Atlas Centaur rocket with a $41 million Intelsat communications satellite was canceled tonight because of what appeared to be trouble with the booster's computer guidance system.

title: BRIEFS
Stripes
description: What's miles long and worn all over? Hint: Green now, it may be lavender on June 30.

title: Direct Action Against Drug Abuse
description: As the Rev. Jesse Jackson ended a speech on drug abuse before 900 high school students, he made an unusual request. He asked any students who used drugs to gather in front of the stage in the Manhattan Center for Science and Math, in East Harlem.

title: Triangle Industries Seeks National Can
description: Triangle Industries said yesterday that it would offer to buy the National Can Corporation for $41 a share, or about $420 million. At the same time, Carl C. Icahn, the New York financier, disclosed in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission that he had acquired 9.1 percent of National Can and said that he was considering buying additional shares.

title: AFTER LEBANON, OPPORTUNITY
description: Even as serious an error of judgment as the Israeli invasion of Lebanon may still yield unexpected good results.

title: OPTROTECH LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: United Nations, American Style
description: In at least one small way, America is in style at the United Nations these days.

title: U.S. SAYS SOVIET WAS THE FIRST TO MILITARIZE SPACE
description: United States and Soviet negotiators held another session today in the arms talks. As they met, an American diplomat, speaking at a forum only a few blocks away, said the Soviet Union had instigated the arms race in space.

title: O'CONNOR INTENDS TO SHIFT MORE PRIESTS TO PARISHES
description: Archbishop John J. O'Connor said yesterday that he intended to strengthen parishes in the Archdiocese of New York by transferring priests from archdiocesan offices into churches.

title: FEDERATED DEPARTMENT STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 2
THEATER: 'UNDERPANTS'
description: I N a cycle of comedies categorized under the title ''Scenes

title: FIRST CITY PROPERTIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a tax credit of $463,000. c-Net loss.

title: Player of Year Has Night of Year
description: Last Thursday night, at a preplayoff banquet in Providence, R.I., the Hockey East Conference named its player of the year, and the honoree turned out to be Chris Terreri, the Providence College goaltender. The award offered testament to the excellence of a season in which Terreri had led the league with a 3.55 goals- against average. But, as remarkable as that may have been, it paled against what was to come.

title: BACKSTOPPING THE ARMS TALKS
description: On Saturday, March 9, shortly after President Reagan had decided what approach the United States would take in the new round of arms control talks with the Soviet Union that would start three days later in Geneva, Louis Nosenzo of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency called a meeting of various Government officials who would be involved in the talks from the Washington end. They translated the President's instructions into a 20-page telegram.

title: OFFICER ACCUSED OF DRINKING IN HIT-AND-RUN CASE
description: The police sergeant accused of driving the patrol car that struck and killed a man on Park Avenue had been drinking before the incident, a prosecutor said yesterday.

title: In Need of a Transplant, Patient Finds Siblings
description: A man who needs a bone marrow transplant if he is to survive a battle with leukemia found his long-lost brother and sister today, and doctors are to determine if either one can be a compatible donor.

title: SAVANNAH ELECTRIC & POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Includes an extraordinary gain of $1,935,000.

title: FRANCE'S CLOUDED FUTURE
description: The results of France's two-stage regional elections have accentuated the now widespread notion that the Socialists will fall from power in parliamentary elections next year. But the outcome of the voting for regional councils on Sunday, in which the conservative and centrist opposition made clear advances, has not clarified a second area of conjecture about the country's political future. It is that France could be moving into a period of institutional instability, something it has not known since the Fourth Republic and the days in the 1950's before the presidency of Charles de Gaulle.

title: AMERICAN HEALTHCARE MANAGEMENT reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Chiat/Day Nike Ads Win the Kelly Award
description: Chiat/Day picked up the fourth annual Stephen E. Kelly Award yesterday, and the $25,000 that goes with it, for the striking advertising it created in behalf of its Nike client.

title: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 20, 1985   The Economy
description: The Ohio Legislature approved a measure to reopen some of the 70 state-insured savings and loans that were closed Friday. Governor Celeste was expected to sign the legislation immediately and a spokesman for the Governor said some of the institutions may be allowed to reopen as early as today. (Page A1.) Earlier, the Governor traveled to Washington to ask Ohio's Congressional delegation for help in his campaign to get Federal deposit insurance for the closed thrift institutions. (D9.) A number of analysts said the financial markets worldwide were displaying a new nervousness over the health of the American banking system. (D9.)

title: REPUBLIC RESOURCES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
A MARSHY BATTLEFIELD IN THE GULF WAR FOUND STREWN WITH IRANIAN CORPSES
description: The thud of artillery filled the marshes and the firetrails of outgoing rockets lighted the twilight sky. Columns of Iraqi tanks clanked eastward through the wetlands on hastily built dirt roads.

title: CAPITAL APPROACHED ABC LAST AUTUMN
description: Some time last fall, Leonard H. Goldenson, the 79-year-old head of the American Broadcasting Companies, got a phone call from a longstanding business associate.

title: SYSTEMS ASSOCIATES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Budget Cuts Seen At Northwestern
description: Northwestern University may slash its athletic budget by 16 percent before the end of the fiscal year because of a projected $500,000 deficit in its $6 million budget.

title: THE POP LIFE
description: ''What is the price of experience?'' asks Van Morrison on his recent album, ''A Sense of Wonder'' (Mercury), quoting the British visionary poet William Blake. ''Do men buy it for a song?/Or wisdom for a dance in the street? No, it is bought with the price/Of all that a man hath/Wisdom is sold in the desolate market where none come to buy.''

title: The Donovan Successor?
description: If President Reagan does not nominate Edward J. Rollins, the White

title: HEAD OF F.D.A. REFUSES TO FORBID SALE OF UNPASTEURIZED MILK
description: The head of the Food and Drug Administration has found that unpasteurized milk presents a public health problem but has declined to bar its sale on the ground that it is a matter handled best by the states, not the Federal Government.

title: NATIONAL LUMBER & SUPPLY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest quarter results reflect lower-than-anticipated expenses in certain areas, as well as a LIFO adjustment due to a lower-than-anticipated inflation rate.

title: IONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
IRAN'S OFFENSIVE CRUSHED BY IRAQ, U.S. AIDES SAY
description: Senior Reagan Administration officials said today that Iran appears to have suffered a crushing defeat in a weeklong offensive aimed at ending its military stalemate with Iraq.

title: Iran Reports Missile Strike
description: Iran said that it had struck Baghdad today with a surface-to-surface missile. It was the fourth such Iranian assertion of a long-range missile attack on the Iraqi capital since last Thursday.

title: CHIRON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
PREMIER INDUSTRIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: The year-ago share earnings adjusted to reflect 3-for-2 stock split paid in January 1985.

title: President Said to Back Claim By Burford on Her Legal Fees
description: President Reagan believes that Anne McGill Burford, former chief of the Environmental Protection Agency, should be reimbursed for the private legal fees incurred before she resigned ''if it is appropriate,'' Larry Speakes, the chief White House spokesman, said today.

title: JUDGE REFUSES TO STOP NEW INQUIRY IN GOETZ CASE
description: A judge in Manhattan yesterday turned down a move by lawyers for Bernhard H. Goetz to stop a new grand jury from considering indicting him in the shooting of four youths in a subway train.

title: Wisconsin Issue
description: A $150 million issue of Wisconsin general obligation bonds was offered yesterday with yields ranging from 5.40 percent in 1986 to 8.75 percent in 1995 and 9.75 percent in 2006 through 2015, through underwriters led by Citibank. The bonds, which are backed by the state's full faith and credit, were rated Aa by Moody's and AA by Standard & Poor's.

title: SCRIPTWRITERS END 2-WEEK STRIKE
description: The Writers Guild of America voted overwhelmingly today to end a two- week-old strike against movie and television producers, but the president of the union said he was unhappy with the pact.

title: 202 DATA SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
ATTACKS ON CHIEF JUSTICE PRESAGE HOT '86 CONTEST
description: Chief Justice Rose Elizabeth Bird of California, the target of seven ouster efforts in her eight years in office, is again facing ferocious attacks as she runs for a full 12-year term.

title: Doyle Dane Chooses Head of Detroit Office
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach International has reached across the sea and into a client's organization in order to get a head for its two-year-old Detroit office. Brian Bowler, 47, has been sales and marketing director of Audi and Volkswagen in Britain, and Detroit office's major client is Volkswagen, which has a plant in Troy, Mich.

title: A JOLLY SAD TALE
description: Big spenders had known for years that England was the place to shop if you wanted an artistic masterpiece as a hedge against inflation.

title: WHAT CAUSES HIGH RATE OF INFANT DEATHS?
description: Federal officials and public health experts are asking why, in an age of medical miracles, the decline in the nation's infant mortality rate has slowed perceptibly. They are expressing concern that 6.8 percent of all babies - 12.4 percent of black babies - are low weight, that is, under 5 1/2 pounds, at birth. Research has demonstrated conclusively that the risk of death increases as birth weight decreases.

title: NEW RESTAURANTS IN LOS ANGELES: A STELLAR CROP
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Praise From Governor
description: Governor Cuomo, a onetime minor leaguer, has congratulated

title: ADVANCE ROSS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $1,276,000 for the quarter and $1,455,000 for the year.

title: ANGELICA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 26
Arco Stockholders Given 2 Measures
description: The Atlantic Richfield Company asked stockholders to approve two anti-takeover measures at the annual meeting in May.

title: Satellite Launching Reset
description: The delayed launching of an Atlas Centaur rocket carrying the world's most advanced commercial communications satellite has been rescheduled for Thursday night, the space agency said today.

title: Golfers Go West for Million-Dollar Purse
description: Golf is one professional sport in which $171,000 still means the same to most of the competitors as it does to the average middle-class American - quite a lot. And a million dollars probably makes a much bigger impression on golfers than it does on many baseball, basketball or football players who have attained that salary.

title: Key Rates
description: * Kenny Index, Kenny Information SystemsSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: A MARKET OF JUST A MIRAGE?
description: The surprise decision by the International Business Machines Corporation to drop its PCjr again raises the question that has plagued the home computer business since its inception: Where is the market for such machines?

title: 28 Cubans Held in U.S. Prison Are Deported by Government
description: A second group of Cubans chosen for deportation by the Federal Government were returned to their homeland Tuesday, the Justice Department said.

title: POSNER AGREES TO SELL HIS NATIONAL CAN STAKE
description: Victor Posner, the Miami businessman, dropped a long-smoldering takeover attack against the National Can Corporation yesterday, and said he would sell his stock in the company to Triangle Industries for nearly $150 million in cash.

title: Cranes to Migrate Soon
description: Officials at the Aransas Wildlife Refuge said today that the 84 rare whooping cranes that winter in south Texas would leave over the next two weeks on the 2,100-mile migration to the Wood Buffalo National Park in Canada. The only remaining wild flock of whooping cranes spends the spring, summer and early fall in Canada, then returns to South Texas in October.

title: Not Too Cuddly
description: The students at Mercer University's campus in Macon, Ga., are rightfully proud of their highly regarded law and business schools, but these days they're finding that the largest share of their pride is directed at something else: their basketball teams.

title: MAN IS CONVICTED IN THE RAPE AND THE ROBBERY OF 7 WOMEN
description: A 27-year-old man was found guilty yesterday of raping and robbing seven women in a series of attacks last year in the Flatbush and East Flatbush sections of Brooklyn.

title: TEXT OF STATEMENT BY FRIAR
description: Following is the text of a statement issued today by the Rev. Leonardo Boff in response to Vatican criticism of his writings, as translated by The New York Times from the Portuguese:

title: Noxious Smoke Causes 1,000 to Leave Homes
description: A fire in a warehouse containing plastic pipes forced the evacuation of about 1,000 people here today after noxious smoke had blanketed the neighborhood and sent at least 21 people to a hospital for treatment of smoke inhalation, officials said.

title: PURCHASE OF FOX RAISES QUESTIONS ABOUT THE STUDIO'S FUTURE
description: Today's announcement that Rupert Murdoch had agreed to purchase 50 percent of 20th Century-Fox, one of America's leading film studios, indicated that the Denver oil man Marvin Davis had learned a lesson in Hollywood: the movie industry, like the oil business, can turn up dry holes. The announcement, which shocked this insular community, included an endorsement by Mr. Murdoch of Barry Diller, Fox's chairman. But it left in doubt, nevertheless, the effect the purchase might have on the kind of films the studio produces. It also raised questions about the future of the former Paramount Pictures executive who had been lured to Fox by Mr. Davis last September by the promise of a lucrative contract that was widely reported, if never confirmed, to include part ownership of Fox.

title: MAY DEPARTMENT STORES CO reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 2
description: The share earnings reflect 3-for-2 stock split last October. The latest fourth quarter net reflects credit of 17 cents a share from use of LIFO method of inventory evaluation and year-ago period's net reflects credit of 10 cents a share.

title: JAMESWAY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 2
Officials Overestimate Smuggling of Cocaine
description: Federal officials said today that they had overestimated the amount of cocaine smuggled into the United States by a cartel when they said it handled up to a quarter of total imports.

title: Vibration Jolted Fatal Plane
description: The crew of a Galaxy Airlines charter flight that crashed in Reno, Nev., Jan. 21 detected trouble a moment after takeoff, recordings of cockpit conversations aboard the plane disclosed today.

title: Shareholder Sues Over MGM Offer
description: Sumner Redstone, an executive from Dedham, Mass., and his National Amusements Inc. have sued MGM/UA Home Entertainment Group Inc. in an effort to prevent its merger with the MGM/UA Entertainment Company. The suit was disclosed in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: HOYAS' JACKSON BECOMES FLOOR LEADER
description: Many coaches and players in recent weeks have exhausted themselves trying to describe the numerous weapons that Coach John Thompson of Georgetown has at his disposal this spring. The analysts begin with Patrick Ewing, the imposing 7-foot center. Then they rave about David Wingate's versatility, Reggie Williams's shooting, Bill Martin's strength inside and Ralph Dalton's improvement.

title: INCOME RISE SLOWS
description: Consumer spending advanced at a healthy rate in February, but personal income rose at the slowest pace in nine months, the Commerce Department said today.

title: A NEW SHAPE IN SOFAS
description: WHEN Vico Magistretti, above, the Italian architect and furniture designer, talks about his latest sofa designs he recalls that the idea for the three-section pieces came one day when he had guests. Everyone was seated on the usual three-seater, and he found it ''impossible to speak,'' he said.

description: Thanks to Commissioner

CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day on March 2 about computers in courtrooms misstated the net income of the Barondata company for the first nine months of 1983. It was $952,000.

title: BRIEFS
RAVEN INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Bridge:Unexpected
description: To find an unexpected defensive play that defeats a game contract is always satisfying. But the ultimate satisfaction comes from doing it in a way that leaves the declarer in a state of shock and reduces his competence on the following deal.

title: Chairman Discusses the Lessons
description: Following are excerpts from the statement of Warren M. Anderson, chairman of the Union Carbide Corporation, on the company's accident at Bhopal, India.

title: A Poster War
description: The acrimonious and still unresolved dispute over the House

title: JET LAG OR NO JET LAG, BUSH IS ON A ROLL
description: In the past two weeks, without skipping a beat, Vice President Bush mingled with starving refugees in central Africa, represented the United States at a state funeral and an inauguration, met with the new Soviet leader, Mikhail S. Gorbachev, underscored continued United States support in Grenada and Honduras and even lectured one of the Administration's leading antagonists, President Daniel Ortega Saavedra of Nicaragua.

title: A PHILANTHROPIST WITH A TASTE FOR WHIMSY VISITS HIS GIFTS
description: It was the morning of the first day of spring, an occasion George T. Delacorte, the 91-year-old philanthropist, celebrated with a walk through Central Park and a visit to his own beloved Alice. Mr. Delacorte's Alice is, of course, the bronze Alice in Wonderland statue that he presented to the city 26 years ago and that has belonged ever since to all children who make the pilgrimage.

title: Argentine Official Presents Charges Against 9 Ex-Rulers
description: A prosecutor outlined charges today against nine former military rulers scheduled to be tried next month and said five face accusations of murder, torture, kidnapping, illegal search, robbery and falsifying documents.

title: OPERA: NEW VERDI STAR
description: WHAT would persuade any music lover to pay a return visit to the Metropolitan Opera's current version of ''Ernani''? Nothing less than the hope of hearing a young singer at the threshold of a major career. The singer's name is Aprile Millo, a young Californian who might just be the next important Verdi soprano. While it would be premature to burden her with the crown of stardom just yet, her performance as Elvira on Tuesday night more than justified my own decision to put up once again with the Metropolitan's heavy-handed, indifferently sung and flabbily conducted production of Verdi's rough-cut fifth opera.

title: FORCED SURGERY BARRED TO GET BULLET IN SUSPECT
description: The Supreme Court ruled 9 to 0 today that the Constitution bars the forced removal of a bullet from the chest of an armed robbery suspect in Richmond.

title: SOUTH AFRICANS DEBATE ISSUES ON ABC 'NIGHTLINE'
description: PERHAPS the question is, why is South Africa doing it? What does it hope to gain? All week, ABC's ''Nightline'' has been broadcasting from South Africa, bringing together Government spokesmen and their critics to debate the nation's racial policies. The debate, which continues through tomorrow, has been passionate, with both sides firm in their convictions. Will it matter? It is impossible to tell, but as television journalism it has been extraordinary.

title: Australia a Coal Leader
description: Australia is expected to become the world's biggest coal-exporting country, with exports exceeding 82 million metric tons in the fiscal year ending June 30, the Government said today.

title: DEGRADING GRACEFULLY
description: WASHINGTON ''Tell me more about the survivability of submarines,'' said President Reagan to his science adviser, George Keyworth, after a meeting in 1981.

title: MURPHY, G C INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After extraordinary gains of $443,000 for the quarter and $1,107,000, or 27 cents a share, for the year. c-After an extraordinary gain of $1,381,000, or 34 cents a share.

title: Casey Wants a Raise
description: At a time when President Reagan is seeking to slice Federal employees' pay checks by 5 percent, William J. Casey, Director of Central Intelligence, is asking for a big salary increase for himself.

title: Why Pay Less to Teen-agers? Would a subminimum wage alleviate high unemployment among teen-agers? The Reagan Administration thinks so. It plans to resubmit legislation to establish a ''youth employment opportunity'' wage for summer workers aged 19 and under.
description: The Administration estimates that this youth wage, to be in effect for three years from each May 1 to Sept. 30, would create 400,000 new jobs annually. But no one knows for sure what its effect would be, which is one reason for proposing a three-year trial.

title: Morris to Get Review
description: The Florida Supreme Court agreed to review later this year the cocaine conviction of
